level.heading: DEFINITIONS (§ 19-499) When used in this chapter the following words shall have the following meanings: Authority – the Washington Convention and Sports Authority. Board of Directors – the Board of Directors of the Authority. Convention Center – the Walter E. Washington Convention Center located at01 Mount Vernon Place, NW, Washington, DC. Convention event – an event for which a reservation of space at theonvention Center includes a commitment to purchase at least 2,500 peak roomights in hotels within the District of Columbia, as determined by DestinationC. First priority – a “Convention event” as defined in this section. Fourth priority – a Non-convention event for which a reservation of spacet the Convention Center may or may not include a commitment to purchase roomights in hotels within the District of Columbia and which describes a one-dayeeting or assembly. Non-convention event – an event other than a Convention event for which aeservation of space at the Convention Center may or may not include aommitment to purchase room nights in hotels within the District of Columbia andhich describes a second, third or fourth priority booking. President and Chief Executive Officer – the President and Chief Executivefficer of the Authority. Second priority – a Non-convention event for which a reservation of spacet the Convention Center may or may not include a commitment to purchase roomights in hotels within the District of Columbia and which describes a publiconsumer show, tradeshow or similar assembly. Third priority – a Non-convention event for which a reservation of spacet the Convention Center may or may not include a commitment to purchase roomights in hotels within the District of Columbia and which describes a local oregional multiple day meeting or assembly.
SOURCE
level.text: Final Rulemaking published at 50 DCR 3035 (April 18, 2003); and asmended by Final Rulemaking published at 56 DCR 1815 (February 27, 2009); asmended by Final Rulemaking published at 60 DCR 8962 (June 14, 2013).
